alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 2:48AM EST until January 13 at 7:16PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage early this morning and crest later this morning around 15.4 feet. It will then fall to 14.5 feet by this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 14.8 Sat 2 am EST 14.9 14.5 14.1 13.5 13.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
